about:
As a transformational CIO, I thrive on driving significant business value and create a competitive edge. Currently, as Head of IT at Redaptive, I'm spearheading a comprehensive AI strategy that will redefine our company's future, laying the groundwork for unprecedented innovation and growth in the rapidly evolving energy efficiency market. My career has been defined by leading organizations through complex transformations, consistently delivering substantial ROI, and building high-performing teams that excel in the face of rapid change.

I believe that AI, automation, and data analytics are the cornerstones of modern business success. Prior to Redaptive, I drove substantial improvements across a variety of industries.  For example at Maxar Technologies, I implemented DevSecOps and CI/CD, enabling a shift from dozens of releases annually to hundreds monthly, dramatically improving time-to-market and sales enablement. At ADT Security Services, my infrastructure transformation improved agent utilization and reduced agent talk time, resulting in over $5M in business value and improved revenue per employee.  Furthermore, I led a 2-year, $20M Capex program at Maxar to modernize infrastructure and drive cloud adoption.  This enabled the processing of two decades of image data, resulting in significant new sales opportunities.

My expertise lies in aligning technology investments with strategic business objectives. I excel at building consensus, managing change, and fostering a culture of innovation. I'm particularly passionate about the responsible and ethical deployment of AI and ensuring that cybersecurity is woven into the fabric of every initiative. With every project I implement layers of cybersecurity and risk management to protect our intellectual property.

I'm a firm believer in continuous learning and staying ahead of the curve in the dynamic tech landscape. I'm eager to connect with fellow leaders, innovators, and anyone passionate about the transformative power of AI and automation. Let's connect and explore how we can build a more sustainable and efficient future together.

#AI #Automation #DigitalTransformation #CIO #Leadership #Innovation #FutureofWork #Technology #MachineLearning #DataAnalytics #RPA #Cloud #SaaS #Cybersecurity #RiskManagement #Agile #ChangeManagement #EnergyEfficiency

about:
Welcome to the world of Data Dave, the renowned data management divemaster and influential leader in data infrastructure, master data management, and data governance. With over a decade of expertise, Data Dave is not just a navigator but a transformative force in the data industry, guiding companies to unlock the full potential of their data assets.

Discover the insights of Dave through his bestselling book, "Crossing the Data Delta: Turning the Data You Have into the Information You Need," which showcases his profound knowledge and passion for leveraging data effectively. His commitment to educating and inspiring others continues with his hit podcast, "Talk Tech with Data Dave." This engaging series explores the latest trends in data, cloud computing, and technology, making complex topics accessible and enjoyable for both beginners and experts in the field.

Whether you're just starting out in data or looking to deepen your expertise, join Data Dave on this exciting journey to demystify the world of data and discover how it can be as captivating as it is crucial. Follow Dave for trailblazing insights and advice that light up the path to data mastery.

My strategic vision has helped businesses overcome complex challenges and align their technology with evolving business goals.

As a hands-on mentor and leader, I have built and managed high-performing global teams of over 50 professionals, including executive leadership roles, to execute transformative initiatives that enhance operational efficiency and scalability. My ability to navigate dynamic environments, including working closely with board members and private equity firms, has allowed me to lead key projects such as enterprise-wide SaaS deployments, ERP integrations, and cybersecurity governance programs.

about:
As the CTO co-founder of Hizitiv, I oversee the development of a revolutionary blockchain infrastructure poised to redefine secure decentralized networks. Hizitiv introduces an innovative dual-consensus mechanism, combining Unified Proof of Stake (UPoS) and Proof of Save (PoSv), setting new benchmarks in scalability, security, synchronization, and sustainability within the blockchain ecosystem.  

The complexity of current blockchain solutions presents a significant barrier to widespread adoption and seamless access to Web3. Developing a user-friendly, high-performance, and interoperable blockchain network is essential to overcoming this challenge. Such a solution would not only redefine usability but also pave the way for large-scale innovation, unlocking blockchain's full potential for decentralized real-world applications.

OUR PRODUCTS/SERVICES INCLUDE:
- Security as a service: Quantum-safe blockchain infrastructure. 
- A general purpose private and public environment: DeFi, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Metaverse, Social and gaming.
- Tokenization platform.
- Exchange of information network.
- Identity management and compliance solutions.
- Multi asset wallet services
- Lab. as a service
- Privacy-first donation systems (Noilliv Donation)  

THE BENEFITS OF USING OUR TECHNOLOGY:
- Process up to 500,000 transactions per second at an average cost of $0.005 per transaction.
- Quantum-safe infrastructure ensuring security, trust and data integrity.
- Machine learning provides automation and synchronization.
- Dual consensus mechanism for scalability and decentralization.
- Fair and transparent participation through our Unified Proof of Stake mechanism.
- A private and public environment for the development of general purpose of Dapps.
- Our eco-friendly blockchain reduces energy consumption.

OUR PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS include
- Venture Capitalists
- Private Investors
- Angel Investors

OUR VALUE PROPOSITION:
Hizitiv is a scalable and compliant, quantum-secure layer 1 blockchain infrastructure designed to provide enhanced transaction throughput across a public and private environment, embracing programmability, privacy and security. Purpose-built for seamless development of decentralized applications and networks. 

If you are interested in reviewing a more inclusive, efficient, and sustainable blockchain
ecosystem, then connect with me here on LinkedIn or email me at sylvainaube@hizitiv.com

www.hizitiv.org

I am an image bearer of God, who serves as experienced IT network and systems administration operations practitioner with a demonstrated history of infrastructure design, development, and support. As an IT infrastructure operations lead, I drive project value by leading teams which build and development resource infrastructures, ensuring availability and performance, supporting the underlying technologies, and managing costs. With over 20 years of experience within information technology, I have cultivated a well-rounded and diverse knowledge base that serves my projects well, whether it is driving local innovations of applications and resources on an enterprise on-premises environment, or implementing a diverse offering of resources and virtual machines in a complex cloud infrastructure. In my experience I’ve found that migration to cloud environments or adoption of cloud services must first start with proper knowledge and experience of cloud environments and how to best utilize those services for your specific application needs. This knowledge and experience start with the project leaders and architects, who direct implementations of cloud concepts and best practices to fit applications needs and provide scalability and resilience, while maintaining the performance that on-premises environments have provided.

Systems thinker. High performance computing enthusiast. Talented technologist.
Arranging bits, bytes and thoughts for the better in life's infinite state machine.

We are either getting better or worse. The constant is change. The variable is the leadership.

Currently achieving the Owl Labs vision of enabling a hybrid work future for everyone. Thinking about the intersections of business process, AI, security and ethics one token at a time.

Software development/library management, hardware, networking and distributed computing workloads. Full life cycle enterprise application management.

I excel in developing innovative products, building strong remote engineering teams, and collaborating with executive teams to streamline business processes and maximize outcomes.

Remote, distributed and immutable systems. Privacy advocate.

about:
Growing up in a small town in Kerala, India, where my father ran a small business, I saw firsthand the ups and downs of entrepreneurship. But I did well in school so my aunt helped pay for college where I discovered my interest in software development. After earning my engineering degree, I was recruited by Infosys and trained in Java and Oracle. I also attended the Infosys Leadership Institute. When I went to work for Neiman Marcus Group I had amazing mentors who set examples around respecting and rewarding people, mentoring, identifying, and developing others’ potential, all while excelling in technology innovation and transformation. This made a lifelong imprint on me.

Today as an entrepreneurial data strategy and technology leader I define, build, execute, and lead initiatives that accelerate operational efficiency, business processes and competitive advantage. I have built and led technology teams across retail, e-commerce, CPG, insurance, and financial verticals. I apply best practices and state of the art tools. By blending subject matter expertise, problem solving and business savvy with enthusiasm, drive, and passion for developing others I deliver results in key areas.

Business and Technology Transformation – Designed data technology roadmap for Transamerica, built data ecosystem on AWS and transformed BI tower into Cloud-first data engineering organization. Rebuilt data and API strategy at Texas Capital Bank. Built five-year technology roadmap for The Software Works, Inc.

Team Building – Established high performing Cloud-first data and software engineering practice at Transamerica, The Software Works Inc., and Texas Capital Bank. Recruited, trained, and mentored people to form agile squads at Neiman Marcus, Transamerica, The Software Works Inc., and Texas Capital Bank. 

Enterprise Architecture and Governance – Built data ecosystem at Transamerica and received certification by AWS and Deloitte as robust ecosystem. Created Lambda architecture at Transamerica and built capabilities to support event-based business actions.

Operational Excellence – Established technology operating models, service governances at Neiman Marcus, Transamerica, and Texas Capital Bank, and adopted best practices. Improved overall service availability, eliminated redundancy, and reduced cost at Transamerica.

Business Startups – Grew business capabilities at The Software Works Inc. Built sustainable software, data and people capabilities at Neiman Marcus, Transamerica, and Texas Capital Bank. Delivered on business goals on-time, built and empowered product teams.

I am an Entrepreneur, a Director of Product, a YouTuber, and featured in Forbes. I have 8 years of experience in developing and launching cutting-edge technology products. I have been invited to be a keynote speaker and a panelist at AI World Conference, AI4.io, LiveWorx Conference, KubeCon, GLOW Women's Leadership Conference, Global Edge Week, Edge Computing Expo, Women In AI podcast, FIREDrill podcast, MIT, Columbia University, Chicago Booth Business School,  and many product management panels.

Currently, as the CEO of the fastest-growing Product Management Professional Development Company in the industry, PM Accelerator. Our innovative and effective leadership has resulted in the company boasting the most engaging alumni network, the highest success rate in landing top-tier offers, and the top-rated program in the PM industry.

Passionate about bridging gaps in education, I founded PMA Kids, a non-profit organization dedicated to providing free product management education training to high school teenagers. Grounded in the principle of social equity, our initiative aims at every paying student through PMA enabling one free education for a child from a low-income family.

I was the Director of Edge Platforms at COX Communications, leading the go-to-market and product strategy of edge platforms.  I launched the first 5G Edge product in collaboration with AWS Wavelength. I also launched an award-winning Machine Vision-based traffic safety product. It was awarded Boston Mayor’s Best Practice in 2017 and deployed in about 10 leading cities in the US.

I co-authored the Enterprise Blockchain for IoT for 400,000+ IEEE members. I filed 3 patents. 

I got a Ph.D. in Materials Science and Engineering from Boston University at the age of 24 (youngest in the program history) with 14 publications. I am an alumnus of MIT Sloan School of Management.

What to get coached by me? Subscribe to my YouTube channel and go to my website www.drnancyli.com/masterclass to submit an application to the PM Accelerator Program and see if you are qualified for the program.

Subscribe to Dr. Nancy Li’s YouTube Channel 
https://www.youtube.com/c/drnancyli?sub_confirmation=1

I'd love to grab a coffee to discuss education topics!

At the helm of City of Cortez's IT department, my role as Director of IT is to ensure seamless operation and strategic growth of our technological landscape. My commitment to technical excellence and strategic foresight continues to drive impactful solutions in the ever-evolving IT domain.

At the helm of LA - Lindeman & Associates' technological revolution, my leadership in digital transformation has realized substantial cost savings and enhanced our operational agility. Spearheading initiatives such as the migration to advanced tech solutions and the implementation of robust cybersecurity measures, these strategic shifts have enabled secure remote workflows and reduced overhead significantly.

My tenure as a Chief Technology Officer has been marked by a commitment to innovation, exemplified by championing the development of custom software for diverse architectures, which has eliminated dependencies on legacy systems. The consolidation of IT operations under a unified strategy has streamlined processes and cut staffing costs, all while maintaining high service quality. Our team's dedication to excellence and strategic vision continues to propel us forward in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

With over 30 years of experience in the video games industry, I am a technology executive who has successfully built and led teams and delivered products across multiple platforms and genres.

As the former Chief Technology Officer at Striking Distance Studios, I oversaw the long-term direction and operations of technology development for the studio, supporting the needs of game and product teams at a technical level and implementing standards to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness. 

I also facilitated introductions to potential strategic partners, investors, and customers as an advisor at AccelByte Inc, a cloud-based platform for game development and live operations. 

My mission is to drive excellence in software products that fulfill both the creative vision and the business requirements, and to empower and mentor highly engaged teams that deliver with passion and pride.

about:
➡️ CREATING FUTURE-READY DIGITAL ECOSYSTEMS WITH GENERATIVE AI & CLOUD
I drive innovation through strategic leadership, transforming IT solutions into impactful, AI-powered Cloud platforms. My focus is on Generative AI and Cloud technologies, leveraging AI for decision-making, problem-solving, and digital transformation. Known for reigniting stalled initiatives, bridging the gap between IT engineering and business needs, and delivering meaningful results.

➡️ HOW I HELP – A SUCCESS STORY

✔️ Challenge:
◆ A legacy IT system, critical to millions of users nationwide, posed security risks and required urgent modernization.

✔️ Objective:
◆ Transform a prototype into a secure, scalable e-commerce portal in Federal AWS Cloud—within just eight weeks.

✔️ My Leadership Actions:
◆ Secured executive buy-in to fast-track the initiative.
◆ Led a cross-functional team and managed a $1M budget, navigating security, cloud, and infrastructure challenges.
◆ Focused on risk management, problem-solving, and consensus-building to overcome roadblocks.

✔️ Outcome:
◆ Delivered the new platform on time for the CEO’s keynote at a National Forum, where it received enthusiastic recognition.

➡️ PASSION FOR GENERATIVE AI, CLOUD & IMPACT
I explore how Generative AI (GenAI) and Cloud technologies transform business operations, enhance productivity, and accelerate digital innovation. From AI-assisted content creation to data-driven insights, I apply AI-powered Cloud solutions to solve complex challenges, bridge technology and business strategy, and drive enterprise transformation.

➡️ MY PROFESSIONAL JOURNEY

✔️ NIH: Visiting Scientist, pioneering computer-assisted methods to assess vaccine effectiveness, benefiting millions of infants.
✔️ NASA: Led IT platform development, pushing technological boundaries and deepening my passion for digital transformation.
✔️ Executive Leadership: Modernized legacy IT systems across nonprofit, Federal, and commercial sectors, enhancing operational efficiency.
✔️ Recent Focus: Generative AI applications and Cloud modernization, leveraging AI-driven tools for strategic decision-making, automation, and innovation in business processes.

➡️ BEYOND THE WORKPLACE
Outside of technology, I find inspiration in nature, wildlife, and photography. Observing landscapes, animals, and plants sharpens my creativity, perspective, and attention to detail—qualities that also shape my approach to leadership and innovation.

I'm a professional nerd.  I was that kid that spent hours typing programs into a Commodore C64 and played the game I entered until my mom needed to vacuum and it went away when I turned off the computer.  It wasn't long before I was changing those games, improving them to my liking and soon after that learned to take iron to bits when I made an interface cable from a design I found on a BBS so I could save my programs to a cassette tape. 

That's what seeded my passion for technology. Over the years it's developed to make me the technician and engineer that I am today and the experiences I've had have taught me a set of professional values that I carry with me every day:

- Think BIG but be sure you also EXECUTE!
- Always do you very best and have fun!
- I did it, you did it- Who cares. The important part is that we WIN!
- Lead by example
- Run towards the fires
- Always work to improve yourself
- Be the calm one

I'm always up to make new professional acquaintances. If you want to talk about technology, good beer, drag racing, or photography by all means reach out to me - denniruz@gmail.com

🖖Welcome to my profile!
Please, no soliciting…🙏

I’m always excited to connect with professionals passionate about IT, AI, and cybersecurity. I’m here to share insights and engage in meaningful conversations through my posts.

About Me:
I am an innovative IT, AI, and cybersecurity professional with over three decades of experience, working with some of the world’s largest companies. After successfully selling a global datacenter business, I’ve ventured into new opportunities, balancing a leadership role in the healthcare industry while building a research and AI development company on weekends and nights.

I thrive on technology innovation, especially in the world of AI. My 1000 square foot home lab, equipped with a personal mini datacenter, is my playground for cutting edge AI advancements and cybersecurity defenses. This is where I stay at the forefront of the industry by experimenting, learning, and pushing boundaries.

I am passionate about mentoring US military veterans transitioning into IT careers. I also make time to mentor others when I can. Just watch for my posts for announcements.

I believe in building strong foundations through roles like help desk, network engineering, and system administration before moving into specialized areas like cybersecurity or AI research. My approach focuses on long term, sustainable success, avoiding shortcuts. I can be strict with mentees but those who stick it out with me have all become successful peers. Most become executives and CEOs because of my experience passed on to them.

I also share humor, fun real world industry quizzes, and unique insights that make IT and cybersecurity more engaging.

Outside of work, I love sharing stories, diving into stock investment trends, and connecting with others who are curious and driven. Whether it’s tech discussions or life lessons, I’m always eager to exchange ideas.

Thanks for stopping by!

about: Experienced and professional IT Director with a demonstrated history of leading IT support teams and projects to success. My strong technical skills paired with my experience in project management allow me to consistently and effectively improve upon the success of IT based operations.

Over the past 20+ years I have worked as a software developer/engineer/coder, engineering team lead, technical manager, platform architect, VP engineering, and technology executive. As a coder and software thinker I tackle and enjoy the challenges and complexities of architectures, systems, scaling problems, bug chasing (and hopefully prevention in the first place - easier said than done!).  

As an avid chess player I enjoy strategy. Picking the right person for the role or picking the right technology approach, thinking about what will happen in response to your choice, how you will respond, how the opponent will respond (even if the 'opponent' is just the circumstances/limitations, budgetary or otherwise). Making good decisions basically.

Most of all, I always enjoy working with fun, smart, people.

My career path has been as follows:

As a consultant working on PKI systems I built systems for banks and financial institutions, building client-server certificate-based authentication mechanisms (involving innovative browser technologies), X509, mutual-auth SSL, CAs.

Then I was part of a ~20 person engineering team that laid the foundations for Currenex, a currency trading startup that was later acquired for $564mil. I did similar work there, centered on security and integration of external trading platforms.

Moving on to Sony I applied my knowledge of crypto systems in the realm of digital media. For the first 5 years I worked on two video/photo services, a music service and then some products that bridged the gap between physical and digital media. I learned a lot about scalability, complex distributed systems, Java, SQL, audio & video transcoding, DRM, client-side browser technologies.

After Sony I went to the B2B side working on various projects for Verizon Digital Media Services, who were at the time providing infrastructure to media content and technology companies. The three main platforms I was involved with were Edgecast, Uplynk and Volicon. Mainly the latter two. Uplynk is an industry-leading video streaming platform. The unit was sold off by Verizon and is now called Edgio.

After that I was head of Engineering for two major video platforms, first Pluto TV (I joined just before ViacomCBS' acquisition and led Engineering during the period of growth from $100m rev. a year to over a billion). Next I built a video streaming platform from scratch for TelevisaUnivision in under a year. The platform now generates pretty high revenue and works fantastically. 
 
Interested in looking for new opportunities, whether in video streaming or not...

about:
tl;dr: Smart Contracts Rule Everything Around Me

Got into crypto when it still meant cryptography and was still classified as a munition by the government.
Went to university for philosophy, because technology changes fast, got a grounding in logic and reason. Picked up a degree in psychology while I was there, because human brains intrude on every thought. Take up game theory & design as a hobby. Went to work in a tech startup munging commercial data, picked up my first "modern" language, automated my job so I had more time to study, and rode that camel into a developer position working on back end systems. Did a bunch of web development for myself and failed to launch a crowdfunding service before kickstarter nailed it. Learned about common technical founder mistakes and the startup game. Started attending startup weekends and contracting while working 9-5 and raising kids. Became manager, then IT director, learned management and delegation, back to engineering before I lost my grasp on current tools. A few more startup efforts and then Ethereum came along, promising smart contracts and trustless escrow, re-igniting my crowdfunding fires and turning them toward programmable trust and value transactions. Won the 2018 Yale-New Haven Startup Weekend with a great team I'm still working with. Started doing Dapp development and met lots of great people. Worked to support the local crypto ecosystem with classes, talks, and events through DappDevs. Connected with a payments industry veteran over his idea for a DLT focused company and got busy researching and building... and here we are!

I'm currently enjoying not only developing technological solutions to old problems, but discovering what new value we can unlock with DLT now that we're able to bring private ledger networks right to participants, harnessing new means of B2B interaction.

Strong opinions, loosely held, often about parts of the future people haven't gotten around to thinking about yet.

Professional with undergraduate degree in Business Administration, graduate degree in Information Technology, Cisco Systems CCNP certification (2021-2024), and professional experience concentration in commercial telecommunication products, data networking, and enterprise I.T. technologies.  Established record of providing executive consultation and managerial oversight for all aspect of I.T. infrastructure including, VoIP, Network Monitoring & Reporting (NMS), Microsoft enterprise technologies, data networking, Linux, and support best practices.  25+ years of continuous technical employment with the last 15+ years in carrier networking & enterprise architecture.

Iqbal’s core focus was bringing the velocity of innovation while closely adhering to the US Federal Government’s “Cloud First", “Mobile First” and “Share First” mandates.

Iqbal is a published speaker & frequently speaks at major technology events. In his most recent appearance, he spoke on ‘Building New Experiences with Google Glass’ and the ‘Future Connected Life’ at The National Association of Broadcasters annual conference in Las Vegas. 

In May 2011, Iqbal completed his Executive Masters from the Wharton School.

In Nov 2013, Iqbal was officially inducted in Google Glass Explorer Program, where he acts as an early adopter and provides vision and strategy towards building Federal Use Cases around Wearable Computing. In the same month, Govt. Computer News selected National Archives & Records Administration's Google Apps for Govt. Deployment, implemented by a Team that he led for the 2013 GCN Award for outstanding IT Achievement in the Federal Govt.

about:
Since 2006, I’ve been proud to be part of Tri-State Expedited, contributing to its growth and success in various roles over the years. I started as Director of IT, where I created technology solutions to tackle the unique challenges of the expedited transportation industry. As a co-owner, I worked with a dedicated team to build a strong foundation for the company. Today, as Chief Information Officer, I’m focused on leading Tri-State into the future as part of the Load1 family.

During my time at Tri-State, I also founded C3D0, where I designed, coded, and led the creation of a custom Transportation Management System (TMS). This system was built specifically to meet Tri-State’s needs, helping us address the complexities of expedited transportation and giving us a competitive edge. The work on our TMS platform not only improved how Tri-State operates but also taught me how technology can make a real difference in solving business challenges.

As CIO, I’m committed to continuing this focus on innovation and ensuring Tri-State stays adaptable and prepared for the future. My key priorities include:

Honoring Our Legacy: Staying true to the teamwork, values, and customer focus that have been central to Tri-State’s success.

Driving Innovation: Updating IT systems and processes to improve efficiency, scalability, and service delivery.

Mergers & Acquisitions: Helping Tri-State transition smoothly into the Load1 family while maximizing the benefits of this new partnership.

Managing Risk: Proactively identifying and addressing operational and technology risks to support long-term growth.

Fostering Growth: Using my experiences at both Tri-State and C3D0 to build systems and strategies that keep the company moving forward.

From founding C3D0 to leading IT at Tri-State, my career has always been about solving problems, empowering teams, and building a strong, successful company. I’m excited to keep driving our mission forward, blending the strength of our past with a clear focus on the future.

Strategic Technology Executive | Driving Innovation, Security, and Scalable Growth

As a results-driven technology leader, I bring extensive expertise in IT strategy, enterprise security, digital transformation, and business intelligence, enabling organizations to leverage technology for scalability, efficiency, and competitive advantage. With a proven track record of managing complex IT ecosystems, I specialize in aligning technology roadmaps with business objectives, optimizing workflows, and leading high-impact technology initiatives that enhance operational resilience.

I excel in fostering cross-functional collaboration with executive leadership, technical teams, and external partners to drive innovation, compliance, and cost efficiency. My leadership extends to budget oversight, contract negotiations, regulatory compliance (SOX, PCI), and business continuity planning, ensuring that IT investments support long-term business growth and security.

Enterprise Security & Compliance: SOX, PCI, threat analysis, and infrastructure audits
Cloud & Infrastructure Optimization: AWS, Office 365, network architecture, and virtualization
Business Intelligence & AI Integration: Data-driven analytics, automation, and AI-driven process optimization

Operational Excellence: Disaster recovery planning, policy development, and workflow automation
Vendor & Budget Management: Contract negotiations, IT procurement, and cost optimization
Adept at navigating evolving technology landscapes, I am committed to positioning organizations for sustained innovation, security, and operational efficiency in an increasingly digital-first world.

about:
Information Technology practitioner with over 25 years experience, no matter work or play technology drives me. Throughout my career I have consistently proven able to hit the ground running, developing high performing technology teams, inspiring others and producing exceptional results. I have a strong track record of creative problem solving; the following is just one of many tales of technology.

While operating a local data center a lightning strike knocked out a phase in the electrical delivery system and arc welded the generator transfer switch into a neutral position. An electrical technician was not available for roughly 8 hours. I ran down to the local hardware store purchased enough extension cords to power our PDU's and had our systems back online within the hour.

From home, the office, to the cloud I am deeply invested in providing an answer to any outside the box problem as quickly as possible.

In my current position is held in the fintech space, I developed and executed a plan across multiple teams and business units to migrate our physical data center to AWS services. This required rearchitecting our core platform to work with cloud system and best practices while maintaining SOC I & II as well as PCI compliance. Utilizing terraform my team and I were able to fully migrate all assets in under six months decreasing overall spend by nearly one million dollars annually and increasing system availability to 99.99% service levels.

My favorite work project was migrating our on-prem Microsoft Active Directory services to a Cloud Directory provider JumpCloud. I was able to integrate JumpCloud with Google Workspaces, local workstations, cloud infrastructure, internal applications and vendor software using SAML, RADIUS, and LDAP services to reduce user provisioning and deprovisioning to just a few clicks.

Emmy award-winning content producer who transitioned into Tech💻(Certified Digerati).

Miami-born Gisela Novoa has carved a unique path in both the media and technology industries. Beginning with a 15-year tenure at networks like Telemundo and Univision, her contributions include the creation of the Emmy Award-winning news series Mi Primer Trabajo and tech segments such as Alta Tecnologia and En la Red, highlighting her passion for storytelling and tech innovation. Notably, she has interviewed influential figures, including Bill Gates.
In 2016, Gisela transitioned to tech, co-leading a Google collaboration in Bogota, where she helped build a tech hub to unify research partnerships and startup opportunities, immersing her in the vibrant world of startups.
In 2017, Gisela embarked on a new chapter in her career by joining the information security team at BankUnited. Mentored by IT leadership, she diligently earned her AWS certification, becoming one of the first at BankUnited to do so. In 2020, she contributed significantly to a pivotal project at BankUnited, transitioning 100% of the IT infrastructure to the cloud within a year. While she views this achievement as a team effort, her role in cost optimization/forecasting and migration has been a testament to her unwavering commitment and passionate approach to problem-solving.

Her career shift from media to tech underscores her adaptability, continuous learning, and steadfast resolve to make meaningful contributions in every role she undertakes.

DeepIntent is a marketing technology company that helps healthcare brands strengthen communication with patients and healthcare professionals by enabling highly effective and performant digital advertising campaigns. Our healthcare technology platform, MarketMatch, connects advertisers, data providers, and publishers to operate the first unified, programmatic marketplace for healthcare marketers. The platform’s built-in identity solution matches digital IDs with clinical, behavioral, and contextual data in real-time so marketers can qualify 1M+ verified HCPs and 225M+ patients to find their most clinically-relevant audiences, and message them on a one-to-one basis in a privacy compliant way. Healthcare marketers use MarketMatch to plan, activate, and measure digital campaigns in ways that best suit their business, from managed service engagements to technical integration or self-service solutions. DeepIntent was founded by Memorial Sloan Kettering alumni in 2015 and acquired by Propel Media, Inc. in 2017. We proudly serve major pharmaceutical and Fortune 500 companies out of our offices in New York, California, and India.

Contact us to learn more (contact@deepintent.com).

about:
I thought I needed a new career – what I really needed was a mission…

For years, I had felt the pull to leave IT, thinking I needed a fresh start in a different field. But after I joined the nonprofit world with the Kimbell Art Museum, I quickly realized that my passion for technology was not the problem; what I needed was a shift to organizations driven by purpose, where technology could play a meaningful role in supporting a larger mission. That’s when I discovered the transformative power of working with nonprofits and educational institutions – and I have never looked back.

With over 20 years in mission-driven sectors, I bring both strategic vision and hands-on technical expertise to organizations seeking impactful digital transformation. From leading cloud migrations and CRM implementations to crafting data governance frameworks, security protocols, compliance policies, and disaster recovery plans, I guide cultural and educational institutions in building secure, reliable technology that protects our data and drives our mission forward.

One accomplishment I’m especially proud of is leading a full-scale cloud migration at the Kimbell Art Museum, which improved data accessibility and streamlined operations, empowering staff to work more efficiently and securely. Additionally, I implemented a comprehensive disaster recovery and data governance framework that has since become a standard for safeguarding critical information and ensuring resilience across the organization.

Whether developing policy, leading and mentoring a team, or providing hands-on technical support, I work to create secure environments where technology fosters both organizational growth and trust. I am passionate about connecting with organizations that view IT as a strategic partner in achieving their vision. If you are looking to leverage technology to drive purpose and impact, let’s connect – I would love to explore how we can make that happen.

about: Over 15 years of experience architecting solutions specifically designed to integrate business strategy with application capabilities. Specializes in Application Development, Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure Technology Management / Operations (DevOps),  and Business Application Integrations.

¡Hola mundo! My name is Miguel Carranza and I am a software engineer from Seville, Spain. I got my first computer when I was 8 years old and I fell in love with technology. Since that moment, the decision to study Computer Science was pretty settled. Afterward, I was fortunate enough to receive a scholarship to take an MSc in Software Engineering at Cranfield University.

Right after graduating from my masters, my life dream of working in Silicon Valley became a reality. Thanks to the program Jovenes con Futuro, I got an internship at MindSnacks, an educational software company in San Francisco. I became a full-time employee soon, and the original 6-month plan ended up turning into 5 and a half amazing years. The experience was phenomenal, I got to work with an incredibly talented team, learned way more than I ever thought was possible, and helped building Elevate, which became Apple’s App of the Year of 2014.

In 2018, I left my job as a Director of Engineering at Elevate to start a new company with my friend Jacob. RevenueCat, the easiest way for app developers to implement mobile subscriptions, launched that summer. We also went through Y-Combinator, and learned from world-class founders.

Currently, I serve as RevenueCat’s CTO. Our team is distributed and our engineers are based in 10 countries and multiple timezones.

Besides computers and learning about company building mistakes, I love surfing, playing guitar/bass, photography and videography. I am also a big fan of Star Wars, pizza, Cool Ranch Doritos and Californian punk-rock. 

I am always excited to have healthy discussions about my interests, analyzing pros and cons, and being constantly learning. Please reach out if you strongly disagree with anything I write here, or if I can be of any help.

about:
I’ve spent most of my career as a software developer, typically somewhere in the financial space.  Writing software is something that I just enjoy.  I do it in my spare time to relax and to keep my mind sharp.  I love the challenge of solving problems with computers.

On the technical side, I’ve been a Microsoft Stack guy from the beginning of my career; C#, ASP.Net, SQL Server, but I’ve done c++ and Oracle in the past.  I’m not graphical, so I tend to do most of my work on the server side.  I can do front end work, using JavaScript, Angular and React, but I do better if there is someone to make things look pretty.  If you want black text on a white background, I’m your guy.  If you want something pretty, you probably want someone with UI skills.  For the record, I know what looks good, I just don’t know how to make something look good.  I’m also working with Python, Go, AWS, Azure, and I own too many Raspberry Pis running everything from simple web servers to a Kubernetes cluster.

I have now transitioned to a software architecture role, which presents its own set of challenges, but its own set of rewards that go with that.

Along the way, I’ve managed teams multiple times and this continues to be a true passion.  I love mentoring developers and helping guide them to be the best that they can be.  People entering the workforce today will be the leaders of tomorrow and giving them a boost only helps everyone.  I will never forget the people who helped to mentor me early in my career and I want to pass that on to the leaders of tomorrow.

Currently, I'm the Head of Infrastructure at Pomelo, a fintech company on a mission to expand financial access and empowerment for immigrants and their families. Pomelo has successfully raised $35M in a Series A round led by Vy Capital, bringing total funding to $55M in equity and securing an additional $125M in warehouse financing. about: Mark Seale is an experienced IT executive with more than 28 years of Information Technology experience including being named a finalist for 2020 Corporate CIO of the Year in Houston.  Known as a hands on problem solver and leader of high performing teams, he has led IT organizations spanning specialized technology teams in the largest corporate environments to designing, implementing, and supporting full IT solutions for start-ups and PE backed M&A ventures.  For the last 3 years he has served as CTO for the City of Houston Health Department, leading their IT initiatives, data modernization, and growing the overall capacity of the team.

A seasoned technology leader with a proven track record of driving strategically aligned transformative change for Fortune 100/500 companies and leading academic institutions. Expertise spans IT strategy, business transformation, product development, enterprise architecture, operations, and large-scale program management across diverse industries including higher education, financial services, media, retail, healthcare, research, and manufacturing.

Currently serving as Chief Technology Officer at Harvard Business School (HBS), leading teams in tackling complex technology challenges including cloud strategy and adoption, enterprise architecture, data and systems architecture, DevOps, Generative AI, and core academic systems. Focused on leveraging cutting-edge technology to empower HBS's mission of educating leaders who make a difference in the world.

Deliver on opportunities for transformational improvement in each industry and role, with some examples being:
• Driving Innovation at HBS: Leading the implementation of modern technologies to enhance the educational experience and operational efficiency.
• Building High-Growth Businesses: As CIO/CTO for MRU Holdings, built and led the IT operation for a student loan startup, scaling to serve hundreds of thousands of customers and build a billion-dollar portfolio.
• Enhancing Customer Experience: Created a million-member online gaming community (IonThunder) ranked in the top 10 by Comscore for repeat visits and usage.
• Transforming Financial Reporting: Led the creation of RCA’s global BI platform, reducing monthly financials closing time by over 90%, later adopted by GE and spun off as IBM Cognos Finance.
• Scaling Rapid Growth: Implemented platforms enabling 10x growth in locations for Sears and Eye Care Centers of America in a single year.
• Delivering Strategic Advisory Services: Advised Standard & Poor’s on global equity index computation (S&P 500 and others) and post-acquisition integration of Citibank’s Salomon Smith Barney Global Equity Indices.
• Leading Large-Scale Transformations: Led award-winning transformations for Serta Simmons and served as interim CIO at DNA Diagnostic Center. Developed innovative approaches to enhance FDA adverse drug event reporting as CIO for health informatics firm Veracuity.

Results-focused leader leveraging technology to drive strategic business outcomes, deliver transformative value, and lead innovative solutions.
